sentences.chinese: 春申君者，楚人也，名歇，姓黃氏。
sentences.literal: Lord Chunshen was a native of Chu, named Xie, of the Huang clan.
He traveled widely in his studies and became broadly learned, serving King Qingxiang of Chu.

sentences.chinese: 頃襄王以歇為辯，使於秦。
sentences.literal: King Qingxiang valued Xie's eloquence and sent him as envoy to Qin.

sentences.chinese: 當是之時，秦已前使白起攻楚，取巫、黔中之郡，拔鄢郢，東至竟陵，楚頃襄王東徙治於陳縣。
sentences.literal: At this time, Qin had already sent Bai Qi to attack Chu earlier, taking the commanderies of Wu and Qianzhong, capturing Ying and Yiling, and advancing east to Jingling. King Qingxiang of Chu moved his capital east to Chen county.

sentences.chinese: 黃歇見楚懷王之為秦所誘而入朝，遂見欺，留死於秦。
sentences.literal: Huang Xie saw that King Huai of Chu had been lured by Qin into attending their court, then deceived, detained, and died in Qin.

sentences.chinese: 頃襄王，其子也，秦輕之，恐壹舉兵而滅楚。
sentences.literal: King Qingxiang was his son. Qin held him in low regard and feared that with one military campaign they could destroy Chu entirely.
Xie then presented a memorial advising King Zhao of Qin:
In all under heaven, none are stronger than Qin and Chu.

sentences.chinese: 兩虎相與鬬而駑犬受其獘，不如善楚。
sentences.literal: When two tigers fight each other, the lame dog benefits from their exhaustion. It would be better to befriend Chu.
When power reaches its zenith, it becomes precarious, like stacking chess pieces high.

sentences.chinese: 先帝文王、莊王之身，三世不妄接地於齊，以絕從親之要。
sentences.literal: The Former Kings Wen and Zhuang refrained for three generations from rashly engaging in battle with Qi, to avoid severing the strategy of alliances through marriage.

sentences.chinese: 今王使盛橋守事於韓，盛橋以其地入秦，是王不用甲，不信威，而得百里之地。
sentences.literal: Now Your Majesty has Sheng Qiao overseeing affairs in Han, and Sheng Qiao has brought his territory into Qin. This means Your Majesty has gained a hundred li of land without deploying troops or displaying might.
Your Majesty can truly be called capable.
Your Majesty's achievements are also numerous.

sentences.chinese: 王休甲息眾，二年而後復之；
sentences.literal: Your Majesty rested the troops for two years, then resumed campaigning.
